title: La chevelure des choses
description: (The hair of things) is an exhibition catalogue by Belgian poet Christian Dotremont and Asger Jorn.

title: Mémoires
description: is an artist's book made by the Danish artist Asger Jorn in collaboration with the French artist and theorist Guy Debord.

title: Asger Jorn Catalogue raisonné Series
description: is a five-volume catalogue raisonné series on the Danish painter Asger Jorn by Guy Atkins and Troels Andersen.

title: Asger Jorn - Supplement - Paintings 1930-1973
description: is the penultimate book in a five-volume catalogue raisonné series on the Danish painter Asger Jorn by Guy Atkins and Troels Andersen.

title: Jorn in Scandinavia 1930-1953
description: is the first book in a five-volume catalogue raisonné series on the Danish painter Asger Jorn by Guy Atkins and Troels Andersen.

title: Asger Jorn - Revised Supplement
description: is the final book in a five-volume catalogue raisonné series on the Danish painter Asger Jorn by Guy Atkins and Troels Andersen.

title: Asger Jorn - The Final Years 1965-1973
description: is the third book in a five-volume catalogue raisonné series on the Danish painter Asger Jorn by Guy Atkins and Troels Andersen.

title: Asger Jorn - The Crucial Years 1954-1964
description: is the second book in a five-volume catalogue raisonné series on the Danish painter Asger Jorn by Guy Atkins and Troels Andersen.

title: Cybernetic Serendipity - The Computer and the Arts
description: is the title of a special 1968 issue of the British magazine 'Studio International.' The issue was first published to coincide with an exhibition entitled 'Cybernetic Serendipity,' dealing broadly with the demonstration of how humans can use the computer and new technology to extend creativity and inventiveness.

title: Klankteksten - Konkrete Poëzie - Visuele Teksten
description: (Sound Texts - Concrete Poetry - Visual Texts) is the title of an exhibition catalogue released in conjunction with the exhibition 'Klankteksten?' at the Stedelijk Museum in Amsterdam, Netherlands in November 1970. The exhibition provided an overview of the concrete poetry movement.

title: 21 Lystegninger
description: (21 Light Drawings) is the title of an exhibition catalogue released by the Aarhus Art Association of 1847 in conjunction with an exhibition of Asger Jorn's light drawings at the Aarhus Festuge 1971.

title: Skånes stenskulptur under 1100-talet
description: (Skåne's Stone Sculpture During the 12th Century) is a book written in Swedish by Erik Cinthio, with photography by Gérard Franceschi and arrangement by Asger Jorn. The book is a photographic documentation of stone sculpture from the 12th century with a focus on the Skåne region of southern Sweden.

title: Signes gravés sur les églises de l'Eure et du Calvados
description: (Signs Engraved on the Churches of Eure and Calvados) is a book written in French and directed by Asger Jorn, with essay contributions from various antiquities experts and photography by Gérard Franceschi.

title: La langue verte et la cuite
description: is a book written in French by Asger Jorn and Noël Arnaud, and edited and published by Jean Jacques Pauvert in 1968.

title: La langue verte et la cuite (Contents)
description: is the complete text of La langue verte et la cuite, a book on structuralist theory and cooking by Asger Jorn and Noël Arnaud, edited and published by Jean Jacques Pauvert in 1968.

title: Asger Jorn à Silkeborg
description: Le musée d'un peintre (Asger Jorn in Silkeborg, a painter's museum) is a partial catalogue of works held by the Silkeborg Museum of Art with a focus on the art of Danish painter Asger Jorn and the relationship that the museum's other works have with Jorn's art.

title: Il giardino delle delizie
description: (The Garden of Delights) is a recording released by Multhipla Records featuring a musical Fluxus performance by Wolf Vostell.

title: Helhesten
description: was a Danish art journal published over nine issues from April 1941 to November 1944 which featured the abstract expressionist art of the Danish avantgarde group of the same name.

title: Helhesten (Year 2, Booklets 5 & 6)
description: is the final issue of the Danish art journal Helhesten, edited by Danish architect Robert Dahlmann Olsen.

title: Helhesten (Year 2, Booklet 4)
description: is the penultimate issue of the Danish art journal Helhesten, edited by Danish architect Robert Dahlmann Olsen.

title: Helhesten (Year 2, Booklets 2 & 3)
description: is the seventh issue of the Danish art journal Helhesten, edited by Danish architect Robert Dahlmann Olsen.

title: Helhesten (Year 2, Booklet 1)
description: is the sixth issue of the Danish art journal Helhesten, edited by Danish architect Robert Dahlmann Olsen.

title: Helhesten (Year 1, Booklets 5 & 6)
description: is the fifth issue of the Danish art journal Helhesten, edited by Danish architect Robert Dahlmann Olsen.

title: Helhesten (Year 1, Booklet 4)
description: is the fourth issue of the Danish art journal Helhesten, edited by Danish architect Robert Dahlmann Olsen.

title: Helhesten (Year 1, Booklet 3)
description: is the third issue of the Danish art journal Helhesten, edited by Danish architect Robert Dahlmann Olsen.

title: Helhesten (Year 1, Booklet 2)
description: is the second issue of the Danish art journal Helhesten, edited by Danish architect Robert Dahlmann Olsen.

title: Helhesten (Year 1, Booklet 1)
description: is the first issue of the Danish art journal Helhesten, edited by Danish architect Robert Dahlmann Olsen.

title: Abschiedssymphonie, Op. 177
description: is a recording released by Edition Block featuring a musical performance by Henning Christiansen, Nam June Paik, and Joseph Beuys.
